⚡Gaming app concept
-
𝗔𝗨𝗧𝗛𝗢𝗥: @ineshkadesilva
𝗕𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗯𝘆: @ui_gradient
-
ITS 2022💥🔥! So im kicking off with a new reel for a gaming app concept! 🎮

Reflecting on 2021, I’m grateful that I started to share my design work on Instagram! Having confidence and self-belief in the quality of my own work is something I wanted to improve and I really believe I made some considerable steps in 2021 Woo! But I believe confidence and growing in my craft and knowledge of design will be a journey that never stops! 🌟

That’s why, looking ahead, I want to continue sharing my work with this community, getting inspired by all the talent out here on instagram and most of all…continuing my learning 🤓💪🏼

As always, let me know what you think in the comments and i welcome any suggestions/ideas for what i could work on next! ⭐️ 

Grateful to everyone! Lets make this year one we won’t forget 🙏🏼🔥
-

⚡ If you don’t pay special attention to how your product looks and feels, you could lose out on many potential customers
-
𝗔𝗨𝗧𝗛𝗢𝗥: @practical.ui
𝗕𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗯𝘆: @ui_gradient
-
In this post I will present some common UX mistakes

- Missing onboarding
- Confusing authentication
- Building for a single platform
- Wrong forms
- Three-click rule

Of course, there are a lot more UX mistakes in the wild, but here I've presented some of them based on my experiences!

-
White space is a design principle where you include space in your design that isn't covered by other elements. 

An example of this would be a written piece where you leave a certain amount of space between the paragraphs and lines of text.

The reason why designers use white space is to make your content less cluttered and easier to read. 

Additionally, it makes your content look more professional, especially if you are designing an advertisement or promotional piece.

Missing the basics of UX/UI Design? 📖

Read countless design blogs, listened to many UX podcasts and watched tons of UI tutorial videos. You’ve got all the recommended books, followed the right design leaders on social media and still, when it comes to your knowledge of UX/UI as a beginner, still lack confidence and a firm foundation.

Sounds familiar? Then this is for you. 👇

Sure, you can find a lot of free resources online about building a career in UX/UI design. But in this process, you might end up with significant gaps in your knowledge—or even worse, you might end up misinformed. ⚡ Which primary button style is your favorite?
-
𝗔𝗨𝗧𝗛𝗢𝗥: @nateworford 
𝗕𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗯𝘆: @ui_gradient
-
Everyone loves a good button! They are great fun because of all the different styling options to experiment with:

- Color
- Corner Radius
- Height
- Text Size
- All Caps vs. Lowercase

On top of that, every button needs to have different styling for these 5 states:

- Disabled
- Enabled
- Hover
- Focused
- Pressed

For those who are wondering, the “Focused” state occurs when the viewer is using a Screenreader to tab through the elements of the page. 

Here are some primary button styles from the following great Design Systems:

- Polaris (by Shopify)
- Carbon (by IBM)
- Pegasus
- Fluent (by Mircosoft)

Don’t forget to swipe to page 2 for UI Kit resources!

Please let me know your thoughts. I hope you enjoy!

Thanks, 

Nate
